Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By The Speaker (Council Member Quinn):
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) or 20-225(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 28 Seventh Avenue South, CB 2 Application no. 20115580 TCM, shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk café, 28 Seventh Ave South, Manhattan (20115580 TCM)

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the purchase of New York state food.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Purchase of New York state food.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing packaging reduction guidelines for contractors with city agencies.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Establishing packaging reduction guidelines for contractors with city agencies.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to amend the General Municipal Law to allow New York City to institute procurement preferences for the purchase of food originating within the New York region.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Contracts
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.
Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: NYS Legislature to amend the General Municipal Law to allow NYC to institute procurement preferences for the purchase of food originating within the NY region.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to enact legislation that regulates the amount and type of packaging used to encase goods procured by the State and all localities.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Contracts
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.
Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Enact legislation that regulates the amount and type of packaging used to encase goods procured by the State and all localities.

Items.Title: Resolution authorizing the Council of the City of New York to intervene or file an amicus brief in Chelsea Business & Property Owners’ Association v. City of New York, for the purpose of defending provisions of the New York City Administrative Code that limit the size of homeless shelters for adults to two hundred persons.
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.
Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Authorizing the Council of the City of New York to intervene or file an amicus brief in Chelsea Business & Property Owners’ Association v. City of New York.
